description: The trap contains QoS statistics for a single RTP session.
The device can send this trap when an RTP session that experienced bad
QoS terminates

event.Summary: RTP $v1 session experienced bad QoS termination: $v7

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD AVAYA-RTP-MIB::avRtpQoSTrap AVAYA-RTP-MIB::avRtpSessionLocAddrV4 a 192.0.2.1 AVAYA-RTP-MIB::avRtpSessionRemAddrV4 a 192.0.2.1 AVAYA-RTP-MIB::avRtpSessionDuration i 9999 AVAYA-RTP-MIB::avRtpSessionCname s EXAMPLE AVAYA-RTP-MIB::avRtpSessionPhone s EXAMPLE AVAYA-RTP-MIB::avRtpSessionSeverity i 1 AVAYA-RTP-MIB::avRtpSessionDebugStr s EXAMPLE

description: The RTP stream local RTP address (IPv4).
variables.name: AVAYA-RTP-MIB::avRtpSessionLocAddrV4

description: The RTP stream Remote RTP address (IPv4).
variables.name: AVAYA-RTP-MIB::avRtpSessionRemAddrV4

description: The duration of the stream in hundredth of seconds
variables.name: AVAYA-RTP-MIB::avRtpSessionDuration

description: The RTP canonical name of the gateway
variables.name: AVAYA-RTP-MIB::avRtpSessionCname

description: A string containing the phone extensions (received for CM), in the format of
<conferenceID>:<extension #1>...<extension #N>
variables.name: AVAYA-RTP-MIB::avRtpSessionPhone

description: The QoS problem severity for the stream. This item equals to
'warning' if a trap was suppose to be sent. and 'cleared' otherwise.
variables.name: AVAYA-RTP-MIB::avRtpSessionSeverity

description: This string contains the major metrics in human readable form. It is used by
the QoS trap.
variables.name: AVAYA-RTP-MIB::avRtpSessionDebugStr

description: The trap indicates that more than XXX RTP sessions currently suffers
from bad QoS.

event.Summary: More than RTP sessions suffers from bad QoS

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD AVAYA-RTP-MIB::avRtpQoSFault AVAYA-RTP-MIB::avRtpQoSFaultTh i 1 AVAYA-RTP-MIB::avRtpQoSClearTh i 0 AVAYA-RTP-MIB::avRtpSessionSeverity i 1

description: The number of concurrent active RTP sessions that suffers from bad QoS
(according to avRtpThresholds) that cause the device to enter a
'QoS fault' state. Note, upon entering this fault state, the device sends
a avRtpQoSFault trap.
variables.name: AVAYA-RTP-MIB::avRtpQoSFaultTh

description: The number of concurrent active RTP sessions that suffers from bad QoS
(according to avRtpThresholds) that clears the 'QoS fault' state.
Note, when the QoS fault clears, the device send a avRtpQoSClear trap.
variables.name: AVAYA-RTP-MIB::avRtpQoSClearTh

description: The QoS problem severity for the stream. This item equals to
'warning' if a trap was suppose to be sent. and 'cleared' otherwise.
variables.name: AVAYA-RTP-MIB::avRtpSessionSeverity

description: This trap indicates that a QoS fault, previously indicated by an
avRtpQoSFault has cleared.

event.Summary: RTP $v1 session bad QoS termination cleared

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD AVAYA-RTP-MIB::avRtpQoSClear AVAYA-RTP-MIB::avRtpQoSFaultTh i 1 AVAYA-RTP-MIB::avRtpQoSClearTh i 0 AVAYA-RTP-MIB::avRtpSessionSeverity i 1

description: The number of concurrent active RTP sessions that suffers from bad QoS
(according to avRtpThresholds) that cause the device to enter a
'QoS fault' state. Note, upon entering this fault state, the device sends
a avRtpQoSFault trap.
variables.name: AVAYA-RTP-MIB::avRtpQoSFaultTh

description: The number of concurrent active RTP sessions that suffers from bad QoS
(according to avRtpThresholds) that clears the 'QoS fault' state.
Note, when the QoS fault clears, the device send a avRtpQoSClear trap.
variables.name: AVAYA-RTP-MIB::avRtpQoSClearTh

description: The QoS problem severity for the stream. This item equals to
'warning' if a trap was suppose to be sent. and 'cleared' otherwise.
variables.name: AVAYA-RTP-MIB::avRtpSessionSeverity
